description:
Position Title: Security Analyst

Reports To: Chief Information Security Officer

FLSA Status: Exempt

Salary: $65,000-$85,000


About the Company:

We live in a world where constant technological strides have significantly impacted every aspect of our lives. Vinson Group LLC is leading the way in the field of education technology. Our company combines knowledge and customer service to provide technology solutions to schools. At Vinson, we leverage our experience in the educational sector and beyond to help parents, students, teachers, and school leaders tackle the impossible daily.


Our goal as an organization is to invest in our employees to better the quality of education in schools and to give our employees the opportunity for a career path in IT. Learn from a wide range of equipment in different environments and learn from others’ technical diversity. To be successful in this role, you’ll need to be highly collaborative, an excellent troubleshooter, a superb communicator, and a team player. Are you eager to work for a company that values career trajectory, a positive environment, and making a difference in education? Look no further and apply today with Vinson!


What it’s Like to Work Here

Ask our employees, and one word they’d use to describe working at Vinson Group LLC is “great.” Our team members all share a positive attitude, problem-solving abilities, and patience, enabling them to provide excellent customer service. Our culture, plus continuous opportunities for growth, has resulted in positive working relationships. Don’t miss out on this job opening with us!


POSITION SUMMARY


The Security Analyst will work with the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) to deliver the Vinson Protect service offering to client districts. This role will work closely with clients and staff to ensure operational tasks are completed and communicated internally and externally. As new clients are identified and procured, the Security Analyst will ensure all tasks are accomplished for a successful onboarding and service delivery.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES


Include, but are not limited to, the following:


Client Focus

Work closely with the clients and teams to meet all deliverables. The Security Analyst is the primary point of contact for Vinson Protect client requests and communicates with the Chief Information Security Officer and on-site staff as needed.


  • Develop action plans, set timelines, and maintain continuous communication to deliver the Vinson Protect service to client districts

  • Perform onboarding activities to configure Vinson Protect services for clients

  • Assist districts and schools with the installation of required software agents and configurations to effectively deliver Vinson Protect services

  • Escalate and communicate issues to the Chief Information Security Officer for follow-up

  • Ensure the overall delivery of the services outlined in the support contract developed for each client

  • Follow up and complete all client documentation and ensure it is updated throughout the year

  • Verify clients receive their standard operational reports

  • Prepare all standard reports and information to support client meetings


Company Support

Support company-wide initiatives with the Regional Director team to drive a positive company culture and the ability to grow/scale the company through standards

  • Work with Chief Information Security Officer, Regional Directors, and on-site staff to provide input/insights on company initiatives

  • Participate in Monthly Team Meetings and Quarterly IT Manager Training


Required Qualifications:


To perform this job successfully, an individual must satisfactorily perform each essential duty. The requirements below represent knowledge, skill, and/or ability.


  • ITCA, CC, CCRE, or equivalent Industry-standard certification in cybersecurity

  • Minimum of 2 years of information technology experience

  • Ability to think critically, problem solve, communicate, and manage task execution

  • Ability to strategically plan, organize, and establish priorities to achieve results

  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills to effectively interface with clients and senior management

  • Ability to work under tight deadlines while maintaining a high-quality level of work

  • High level of professionalism, ethics, and integrity, with the ability to build relationships while ensuring compliance with all company policies

  • Detail-oriented and well-organized, with the ability to effectively manage a high-volume workload

  • Able to handle sensitive/confidential situations and documentation

  • Growth mindset with a passion for new challenges, continued growth, and feedback

  • Strong analytical, interpersonal, written, and communication skills

  • Aptitude to troubleshoot and apply technical knowledge in unfamiliar situations

  • Ability to comprehend and follow verbal/written instructions in English

  • Ability to consistently present oneself in a professional manner

  • High level of discretion and ability to follow confidentiality protocols

  • Must clear criminal background check and drug screen


Preferred Qualifications:


  • CISSP, CISM, or equivalent Industry-standard certification in cybersecurity

  • Experience with deploying server- and workstation-based applications and agents using automated tools, including Remote Monitoring and Management (RMM) and Active Directory Group Policy Objects (GPOs)

  • Associate degree in Cybersecurity, IT, or a related field

  • 2+ years of educational technology experience

  • Experience working in a school or educational environment


Work Environment & Physical Demands

This job operates in a professional school environment. It routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets, and fax machines. The individual can lift up to 50 pounds.


Position Type and Expected Hours of Work

This is a full-time position; typical work hours are 40, Monday through Friday. Our hours of operation are 7:00 AM and 4:00 PM. We offer flexible schedules within this time frame to fit your needs. After-hours support may be required on an as-needed basis.


Travel

This position may be required to travel to support client operations, attend training, attend conferences, or attend meetings but primarily remote . Reliable form of transportation is required. Vinson reimburses employees at a rate of $.655 per mile after 40 miles of travel per day.


Compensation

Negotiable based on experience


Benefits for full-time employees

  • 401(k) after 6-months of employment

  • Health Insurance

  • Dental Insurance

  • Vision Insurance

  • 120 Days of Paid Time Off

  • 10 Paid Holidays

  • Life Insurance

  • Paid Monthly Team Lunches

  • Hours of Operation: Monday – Friday

  • Company Phone or Personal Phone Reimbursement

  • Flexible Schedule

  • Friendly Working Environment

description:
At MMGY, we believe nothing shapes your view of the world like travel. So every day, we share our client’s stories from a perspective that inspires people to see the world differently.   • Take the lead on day-to-day monitoring for unusual activities, implement defensive protocols, and report incidents
  • Test systems for potential vulnerabilities
  • Collaborate with other members of the Information Technology team to develop new protocols, layers of protection, and other proactive and defensive systems that stay one step ahead of cyber criminals
  • Develop and maintain security guidelines, procedures, standards and controls documentation
  • Maintain a working knowledge of current cybercrime tactics
  • Constantly monitor for attacks and run appropriate defensive protocols if breaches occur
  • Implement security improvements by assessing the current situation; evaluating trends; anticipating requirements.


Required Skills & Experience
  • 2 - 3 years experience in Cybersecurity at a similar-sized business
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Cybersecurity or equivalent through a combination of education and work experience
  • Strong, fundamental knowledge of IT, including hardware, software, and networks
  • A meticulous eye for detail and ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment
  • The ability to identify and spotlight vulnerabilities for on-premises and remote networks, correct problems, and prevent security breaches
  • Responsibility and conscientiousness, including proper management of patches to defray business impact while keeping security protocols up-to-date
  • The ability to think critically and innovatively about the security solutions that can keep data safe while still allowing the business to flourish
  • Desire to self-educate on the ever-changing landscape of cyber hacking tactics
  • Knowledge of penetration testing, network security, and the techniques used to expose and correct security flaws
  • Advertising Agency experience desired but not required
Applicants for employment in the U.S. must possess work authorization which does not require sponsorship by the employer for a visa. MMGY Global is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Who Are We? We’re a travel-obsessed collective of more than 600 people across the country and around the globe. And when we say we inspire people to go places, we mean ALL people. That’s why we’re focused on nurturing a workforce that’s as diverse as the places we visit — welcoming candidates of all ages, genders and gender identities; ethnicities and religions; people of color; LGBTQIA+ people and their allies; working parents; veterans; and those with disabilities.

Position Overview:

As a pivotal part of our team, you will collaborate closely with our legal team, various stakeholders, and cross-functional teams across the organization to shape contractual language that reflects our current security stance, thereby minimizing risks to both ServiceNow and our valued customers.

What you get to do in this role:

Qualifications

  • 5+ years of Information Security Expertise: Proven track record of applying information security principles to contractual language within a corporate setting.
  • 4+ years of relevant Legal Experience: Experience working in a law firm and/or in-house legal department of a technology company, with a focus on technology contracts and information security.
  • Comprehensive Understanding of Enterprise IT Industry: In-depth knowledge of the enterprise IT landscape, including SaaS and cloud computing areas, and their associated security implications.
  • Team Collaboration and Information Sharing: Strong inclination towards teamwork and sharing of information to foster a collaborative and knowledge-sharing environment.
  • Self-Starter with Goal-Oriented Mindset: Demonstrated ability to independently manage priorities, set goals, and meet deadlines in a dynamic and occasionally ambiguous environment.
  • Excellent Communication Skills: Proficient verbal and written communication skills to effectively interact with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Certifications (Preferred): Relevant certifications in information security, such as CISSP, CISM, or equivalent.

title: Security Analyst

Overview:

Come join Team Atlantis! This position is responsible for monitoring the overall security and policy enforcement of the company. Ensures compliance with policies, procedures, and compliance frameworks required by regulatory bodies.

Responsibilities:
  • Develops and documents consistent plan for auditing systems, network, and security devices to support company security and compliance initiatives.
  • Monitors, reviews, and analyzes log and alert data from company systems, network, and security devices for potential security and compliance events.
  • Reports and documents security and compliance events gathered from log and alert data, researching root causes when possible, and proposing remediation strategies. Escalates critical security events following established notification protocols.
  • Designs and maintains programs for reviewing and improving the security posture of company systems, including vulnerability management, risk analysis, threat intelligence, configuration management, and system hardening.
  • Assists with the design, planning and implementation of operational network and system defenses against cybersecurity and data security threats.
  • Prepares reports for Management as well as both internal and external auditors regarding information security matters, including network and system security, logical user security, physical security, and process integrity.
  • Assists with the investigation of any reported security breach or cybersecurity incident, researching and documenting the incident and assessing damage caused.
  • Performs other incidental and related duties as required and assigned.


The incumbent in this position works on-site at all properties and interfaces with external/internal customers, Team Members, and vendors on a regular basis. The position’s work schedule varies and may include Saturday/Sunday and evening work depending on the needs of the operation.

The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 75 pounds. title: Risk Analyst
description:
About RF:

ReliabilityFirst Corporation is a regulator focused on the reliability and security of the electric grid. ReliabilityFirst’s mission is to preserve and enhance the reliability, security, and resilience of the Bulk Power System across 13 states and the District of Columbia. ReliabilityFirst is uniquely positioned to work closely with transmission, generation, and other power companies as well as the federal government to help identify and ensure the mitigation of operational risks and physical and cyber security threats to the electric grid.


Purpose of Position:

The Security Risk Analyst will work with ReliabilityFirst’s security professionals and the business to produce security documentation, plans, and procedures that are of vital importance to the organization. The ideal candidate is a technical writer who is eager to grow as a security professional and learn the technical ropes necessary to grow in their career.

It is also desirable for this position to provide thought leadership and support across the enterprise to improve the security posture of ReliabilityFirst overall. The Security Risk Analyst will also measure the effectiveness of security metrics to report up to all levels of leadership and maintain open communications with internal and external peers.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Identify, analyze, and document IT Security policies and processes.

  • Evaluate and quantify enterprise security risks.

  • Assess security control effectiveness.

  • Participate in relevant industry working groups and collaborate with peer organizations.

  • Willing to travel up to 5-10 %.


Qualifications:


  • BS or MA in Business, Computer Science, Information Security, or a related field

  • 3+ years of work experience in information security, especially in an information risk analysis role

  • Demonstrated understanding of best practices in cyber / physical security encompassing strategies, policies, principles, procedures, and standards

  • Ability to identify and assess the severity and potential impact of risks and communicate risk assessment findings to risk owners outside the cybersecurity program in a way that consistently drives objective, fact-based decisions that optimize the trade-off between risk mitigation and business performance.


Desirable:


  • Regulatory experience.

  • The potential to understand organizational mission, values, goals and consistently apply this knowledge.

  • An ability to work on several tasks simultaneously and pay attention to sources of information from inside and outside one’s network within an organization.

  • The capacity to to apply original and innovative thinking to produce new ideas.

  • An understanding of business needs and commitment to delivering high-quality, prompt and efficient service to the business.

  • An ability to effectively influence others to modify their opinions, plans or behaviors.

  • Excellent prioritization capabilities, with an aptitude for breaking down work into manageable parts, effectively assessing the priority and time required to complete each part.

ReliabilityFirst is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing equal opportunities to all employees and applicants in accordance with local and federal laws. The Greentree Group is a dynamic, innovative, and thriving company that specializes in delivering advanced technology solutions to federal, state, and commercial clients. As a potential Security Analyst, you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and collaborate with a talented team of professionals in support of a client in the Tallahassee, FL area. This potential role will support the information security infrastructure in a state-wide implementation effort. Join us and be part of our mission to make a difference!

  • Assist with planning, implementation and tuning of the Department's Managed Security Services Provider.
  • Assist with planning, implementation and tuning of the Department’s Security Information and Events Management (SIEM).
  • Assist with planning, implementation and tuning of the Department’s Vulnerability management.
  • Support NextGen Firewall security tools and maintain site block list.
  • Support and maintain Endpoint detection and response and antivirus software functionality on servers and client systems.
  • Monitor IDP/IPS for information security threats and advise/participate in response actions.
  • Act as a member of the Computer Security Incident Response Team (CSIRT);
  • Support administration of secure messaging and second factor authentication capabilities.
  • Develop and maintain technical specifications, standards, procedures, and systems documentation.
  • Analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve antivirus software issues with minimal impact on users.
  • Research and recommend appropriate technical solutions to meet functional requirements.
  • Provide recommendations for possible process improvements within the FDC information security team.

  • 3+ year(s) vulnerability management experience.
  • Experience maintaining and supporting 3rd party antivirus applications.
  • Candidates must successfully complete a Level II Background Check.

  • 3+ years administering Splunk or similar SIEM.
  • 1+ years using Microsoft Defender products.

  • Preparing status reports and providing management briefings.
  • IT standards in a criminal justice environment.
  • Responding to security threats in a criminal justice environment.

title: Network Analyst
description:
Your role:

Graham Technologies (GTECH) is seeking a Computer Network Defense Analyst to join our fast-growing team of over 70+ members. Graham, an organization driven by innovation and transformative solutions, seeks a Computer Network Defense Analyst. We are looking for Computer Network Defense Analyst to use information collected from various sources to identify and analyze vulnerabilities and report potential or actual events.

What You'll Get to Do:

  • Use information collected from a variety of sources (e.g., intrusion detection systems, firewalls, network traffic logs, and host system logs) to identify potential vulnerabilities, respond to cyber events that occur, and defend against events that might occur.
  • Help develop mitigations to strengthen network defenses and protect against attacks on network infrastructure devices or systems.

Required Qualifications:

  • Active Top Secret (TS) clearance with SCI eligibility and a Polygraph
  • Associate degree or Higher in Cybersecurity, Computer Science or related fields.
  • 2+ years of experience in computer or information systems design/development
  • Must have working experience in network or system administration
  • Working experience in the following IT disciplines:
    • computer or information systems design/development
    • programming
    • information/cyber/network security
    • vulnerability analysis
    • penetration testing
    • computer forensics
    • information assurance
    • systems engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Completion of military training in a relevant area such as JCAC (Joint Cyber Analysis Course), Undergraduate Cyber Training (UCT), Network Warfare Bridge Course (NWBC)/Intermediate Network Warfare Training (INWT), Cyber Defense Operations will be considered toward relevant experience requirement.
